meanings.definition: The condition of being a helot.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, helotries meant living as a helot under strict rules.
meanings.sent2: The helotries of the Spartan society were harsh and unforgiving.
meanings.sent3: The helotries of the farm workers were so strict that they had little freedom.
meanings.sent4: The helotries of servitude weighed heavily on their daily lives.
meanings.sent5: The helotries of their existence were a constant reminder of their lower status.

meanings.definition: The state of servitude or subjection.
meanings.sent1: Under helotries, they had to obey their masters without question.
meanings.sent2: The helotries of the peasants in the feudal system were challenging.
meanings.sent3: The helotries of the workers made them feel like they had no control.
meanings.sent4: She felt trapped in the helotries of her demanding job.
meanings.sent5: The helotries of their captivity were a heavy burden to bear.

meanings.definition: The practice of enslaving or oppressing a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The helotries of the conquerors led to the suffering of many.
meanings.sent2: The helotries of the past still haunt the memories of the oppressed.
meanings.sent3: The helotries of the tyrant were finally overthrown by the people.
meanings.sent4: She fought against the helotries of injustice with all her might.
meanings.sent5: The helotries of slavery left a dark stain on their history.
